Data: Behrendorff to Rahul, 1 run length ball on off, and he covers his off stumps, before tapping a shot to point with the bat's open face. Off the mark, straightaway
Behrendorff to S Dhawan, no run length ball, just outside off, and blocked off the back foot after shuffling across
Behrendorff to S Dhawan, 1 leg bye appeal for lbw but not given. Full on off, and angling inwards. Tries to whip it off his legs, but the ball hits his back leg. Rolls away to square leg
Behrendorff to Rahul, no run length ball on leg stump, and clipped off the back foot to square leg
Behrendorff to Rahul, 1 run length ball on leg, but jags further into his pads. Worked off his pads to the vacant square-leg region
Behrendorff to S Dhawan, no run length ball, just outside off, and tapped off the back foot to cover. Played with soft hands
Jhye Richardson to Rahul, no run full and wide outside off, and KL Rahul chooses not to chase after it. Could've driven, but opts to shoulder his arms
Jhye Richardson to Rahul, no run length ball on off, but angling into his body. Tries to nudge it away to square leg, but leading edge takes the ball to point instead!
Jhye Richardson to Rahul, 1 run full on middle, and drifting into his pads. Flicked off his pads to deep backward square. Short runs around the boundary to intercept
Jhye Richardson to S Dhawan, no run length ball on off, and angling away from Dhawan. Throws his hands at this, trying to punch square with the bat's open face. Finds point though
Jhye Richardson to S Dhawan, no run back of a length on middle, and Dhawan takes a couple of steps forward to meet the ball. Punched to cover point, but can't pierce the gap

Jhye Richardson to S Dhawan, no run length ball on leg stump, and arrives near Dhawan's gut. Tries to muscle a flat-batted shot to the leg side, but it flies off the bat's splice. Rolls back to Richardson. Tidy over
Behrendorff to Rahul, FOUR runs slapped! Length ball on middle, and going across the right-hander. Throws his hands at this, and cuts a shot past point
Behrendorff to Rahul, 1 run back of a length outside leg stump, and he rides the bounce to nudge a shot away to fine leg for a walking single

Behrendorff to S Dhawan, FOUR runs whipped! Length ball angling into his body, but Dhawan skips down the wicket, and muscles a leg-side shot over the infield. A couple of bounces, and into the cow-corner boundary
Behrendorff to S Dhawan, 1 run back of a length on off, and Dhawan uses his feet again. Punched to cover on this occasion
Behrendorff to Rahul, 1 run back of a length, slightly slower from Behrendorff. Worked off his hips to deep square leg for one
Behrendorff to S Dhawan, 1 run length ball on middle, and angling into Dhawan. Nudged off his pads - with soft hands - to the leg side, and off they go for a single
Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, no run full-ish on middle, and he mistimes a clip to square leg. Ball rolls away to the leg side as Dhawan calls for the single
Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, no run offcutter on leg stump, and Dhawan shapes up to pull over the leg side. Ball stays low, and it hits him near the abdomen! Ouch.
Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, 1 wide extra short on middle, and the ball balloons over Dhawan's head. He tries to ramp it over the keeper, but can't get the connection. Umpire spreads his arms wide

Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, 1 wide slower ball, just outside leg, and Dhawan looks to clip this fine. But he can't get the connection once again, and the ball rolls into the keeper's gloves. Coulter-Nile isn't pleased, the ball nearly brushed leg stump there
Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, 1 run offcutter on leg stump, and he inside-edges a defensive shot onto his pads. Ball dribbles away to the off side as Rahul tells Dhawan to run
Coulter-Nile to Rahul, FOUR runs check-pulled! Back of a length on off, but the ball's angling in. Rahul swivels on one foot, and lifts a controlled shot over the infielder at short fine-leg
Coulter-Nile to Rahul, no run short and wide, and Rahul tries to slap a cut in front of square. Hits the bat's inside-half and rolls back to Coulter-Nile
Coulter-Nile to Rahul, 1 run back of a length, wide outside off, and steered down to third man for a jogging single
Jhye Richardson to Rahul, no run length ball, wide outside off but coming inwards. Defended off the back foot to short cover
Jhye Richardson to Rahul, 1 run back of a length just outside off, and he shuffles onto the back foot to defend. Ball dribbles to the off side as Rahul scampers across for one
Jhye Richardson to S Dhawan, 1 run length ball angling across, and punched to cover. D'Arcy Short dives to his left, and parries the ball to Maxwell, who cleans up the fielding effort
Jhye Richardson to Rahul, SIX runs top-edged! But for six! Short on middle, and Rahul took his eyes off the ball, but the pulled-shot finds a meaty top edge, and flies into the stands beyond fine leg

Jhye Richardson to Rahul, SIX runs full and wide outside off, and lifted into the stands! Width offered, and Rahul prods forward before confidently driving over the infield. Someone in the crowd makes a mess of the catch too
Jhye Richardson to Rahul, 1 run back of a length just outside off, and smartly steered to point off the back foot. He'll keep strike
Cummins to Rahul, 1 run back of a length on middle, and he rides the bounce, before turning this away to square leg with gentle hands. They scamper across for one
Cummins to S Dhawan, no run length ball on middle, and Dhawan shuffles across to the off side - exposing all three stumps - but he mistimes an attempted paddle-shot to short fine leg
Cummins to S Dhawan, 1 run smacked! But straight to deep square leg. Back of a length on middle, and he clatters a pull to the leg side
Cummins to Rahul, SIX runs what a shot! Full on middle, right near his toes, and he nonchalantly flicks this over deep midwicket! All the work done by Rahul's bottom-hand. Proper whippage

Cummins to Rahul, SIX runs pulled over backward square! Rahul was almost expecting that given the last full ball went for six. Stays on the back foot, meets the ball near his chest, and hooks a shot for another half-a-dozen

Cummins to Rahul, no run Rahul's down! Back of a length on middle, and he looks to defend, but the ball holds it's line, and hits Rahul near his abdomen. He falls forward, facepalming the pitch, but his feet are inside the crease. 53 for 0 after the Powerplay
Zampa to S Dhawan, 1 run flighted full outside off, and the ball skids further away. Drives away from his body, but no real power there. Stopped at cover point
Zampa to Rahul, FOUR runs length ball on middle, but another skidder going down the leg side. Allows the ball to reach him, before flicking fine past the keeper's left
Zampa to Rahul, 1 run full on middle, and he comes down the ground to meet the ball. Drives a shot right into the pitch, and the ball goes back to Zampa. Palms the ball away to mid-off
Zampa to S Dhawan, 1 run full on middle, and Dhawan comes down the ground to muscle an on-drive to wide long-on
Zampa to Rahul, no run length ball, just outside off, and turning away. Defended off the back foot to cover
Zampa to Rahul, 1 run full just outside off, and pushed to deep extra cover for a walking single

Coulter-Nile to Rahul, OUT ramped straight to third man! Back of a length outside off, and Rahul opens his shoulders to play a cheeky shot over third man. Done in by the lack of pace (119 kph) and the uppercut lobs in the air. No mistake from Richardson running in
Coulter-Nile to Kohli, 1 run full and wide outside off, and Kohli drives away from his body. Outside-edge past first slip to third man
Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, no run length ball on off, and coming into his body. Nudged off the back foot to square leg
Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, 1 run back of a length on middle, and he tries to muscle a pulled shot. Mistimed along the ground to deep midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Kohli, 1 run length ball, too wide outside off, but Kohli chases after it. Cut square to the fielder manning the boundary on the off side

Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, 1 leg bye offcutter, full outside leg stump. Dhawan tries to whip this behind square, but ball hits his front leg. No appeal for lbw, since the ball didn't pitch on the stumps. Ball rolls away to the leg side as the batsmen pinch a single
Zampa to S Dhawan, 1 run full on middle, and pushed off the front foot to cover for a quick single
Zampa to Kohli, no run length ball, wide outside off, and turning further away. Kohli tries to defend, but toe-ends the shot to the off side
Zampa to Kohli, no run length ball on middle, and skidding in. Worked off the back foot to midwicket, but they can't pinch the run
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run length ball on middle, and he opens his stance to flat-bat a pulled shot to long-on
Zampa to S Dhawan, 1 run length ball on leg, cramping Dhawan for space. Mistimes a pulled shot past short fine-leg to the man in the deep

Zampa to Kohli, 2 runs slider on middle, and Kohli pulls along the ground to deep midwicket. Kohli completes the single quickly, but pushes Dhawan for the second. Sharp throw from Jhye Richardson and it's a direct hit! But Kohli's dive saves him. That was closer than he would've liked. Big roar from the crowd
Behrendorff to S Dhawan, no run play and a miss! Back of a length outside off, and he goes for the pull. Ball whizzes under his bat

Behrendorff to S Dhawan, OUT full outside off, and he opens the bat's face to drive over cover. Stoinis, though, runs in from the boundary and dives forward to take a stunning catch. But it's been taken so close to the ground, that the umpires want to have a second look. Not sure which team will be happier with the wicket. Replays suggest that the ball did hit the ground, but his fingers may have been under it by then. Soft signal was out so this should
Behrendorff to Kohli, 1 run full on off, and guided off the front foot to third man for a single
Behrendorff to Pant, no run length ball, wide outside off, and he presses forward to punch. Stopped by cover
Behrendorff to Pant, 1 run length ball, angling in, and nudged to the leg side. Gets off the mark
Behrendorff to Kohli, 1 run length ball on middle, and he guides this from near his body with the bat's open face to point. They jog across for one
Short to Kohli, 1 run long-hop to start, but it slows down off the track and Kohli drags a pull from wide outside off to deep midwicket
Short to Pant, no run back of a length outside off, cut crisply to backward point
Short to Pant, no run and again, a nice-looking, firmly struck cut, straight to backward point
Short to Pant, no run ripping turn this time, similar line and length to the previous two balls. Pant is unsure whether to cut or leave, and he ends up not connecting

Short to Pant, OUT gone, the pressure's told on Pant! Tosses this one up enticingly, a fair way outside off stump, and Pant goes for the big heave and loses his shape. Wasn't quite full enough for him to control perfectly, and it turns and skews up in the air for Jhye Richardson to take an outstanding catch, sprinting to his left from long-off and throwing himself horizontally at the ball
Short to Dhoni, no run very full on off stump, jabbed to midwicket
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run shortish, close to off stump, hurries through and Kohli pulls along the ground to long-on

Zampa to Dhoni, no run ooh, that skids through, and is past Dhoni and leads to a hesitant appeal for a stumping. Up it goes to the third umpire. Quickish ball outside off, dips a little shorter than Dhoni expects as he walks forward to try and play it into the covers. Goes with the angle, past his inside edge, but he does extremely well, almost does a full split, to stretch his back leg back and juuust land it past the line
Zampa to Dhoni, no run flighted a little slower outside off, slapped to cover
Zampa to Dhoni, 1 run a bit of flight again, this time he flat-bats down to long-off

Zampa to Kohli, FOUR runs not that short at all, but Kohli is onto the back foot in a flash to create a boundary opportunity. Not that wide either, but the footwork has made this a cuttable ball, past the left hand of the diving backward point fielder
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run tossed up outside off, driven to sweeper cover
Short to Kohli, 1 run flattish, back of a length, angling across the stumps from over the wicket. Rocks back to pull to the right of long-on
Short to Dhoni, no run slowed down, pitching just outside leg. Dhoni goes down on one knee for the leg-side heave, plays too early and misses and is hit on the back leg

Short to Dhoni, SIX runs another delivery along a similar trajectory, flighted and inviting Dhoni to go for another slog-sweep. Dhoni watches it better this time, and the ball soars way over the midwicket boundary
Short to Dhoni, no run flatter now, on middle stump, goes back to whip it but can't get it past midwicket
Short to Dhoni, 1 run short googly outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
Short to Kohli, 1 run flat again, straightens towards middle and leg, goes deep in his crease to pull to deep square leg
Cummins to Kohli, 2 runs length ball outside off, carved up and over the covers, to the right of the sweeper. Not quite middled - he may have wanted to hit it straighter than where it landed up
Cummins to Kohli, 1 run back of a length on off stump, pulled to long leg, off the inner half of the bat. Kohli seems to be going a little too hard at some of his shots today
Cummins to Dhoni, no run back of a length on off stump, opens up a touch and flat-bats to extra-cover
Cummins to Dhoni, FOUR runs fuller now, angling into middle and off, and Dhoni hammers it away, clearing his front leg and simply bashing it down the ground, between the bowler and mid-off
Cummins to Dhoni, 1 run back of a length, angling into leg stump, worked away to long leg
Cummins to Kohli, 1 run back of a length on off stump, carved away to deep point
Jhye Richardson to Kohli, 1 run wide, shortish slower ball, reaches out and slaps towards third man

Jhye Richardson to Dhoni, FOUR runs short and wide, and Dhoni puts it away with ease, gets up on his toes and cracks it away to the point boundary, in the air to the right of the fielder at backward point
Jhye Richardson to Dhoni, 1 run back of a length on middle and off, punched to long-off

Jhye Richardson to Kohli, SIX runs length ball on off stump, and Kohli shuffles away from the line to make a bit of room, and lofts it cleanly, into the gap and over the boundary, to the left of long-off

Jhye Richardson to Kohli, 2 runs a bit wider, Kohli has to reach out for it. Goes hard at the ball, a kind of front-foot uppercut, and third man, running to his right and diving, can't quite get to it before it bounces, but he can keep it from going to the boundary. Zampa the fielder

Jhye Richardson to Kohli, no run ooh, that was pretty much in the slot, and Kohli isn't too pleased with himself. Fullish, a bit of width outside off, and Kohli swings a little too early and misses his lofted off drive. May have been the slower ball, mind
Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, 2 runs slower ball, back of a length, angling into the body. Dhoni swivels to pull it off his hip towards long leg
Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, 1 run slower ball, full and fairly wide of off. Dhoni drags it along the ground to long-on, bringing his bottom hand into play

Coulter-Nile to Kohli, SIX runs and yet, he can hit shots like this. Another slower ball, on a length and finishing on about off stump. Kohli just brings his wrists into play and flicks it all the way over the midwicket boundary
Coulter-Nile to Kohli, SIX runs and another! Similar length, wider this time, and Kohli frees his arms to deposit it high over the extra-cover boundary

Coulter-Nile to Kohli, SIX runs That's a Mahendra Singh Kohli shot alright! A couple of steps down the pitch to the off-stump length ball, and he brings his wrists into play once more to whip it high over the forward square leg boundary
Coulter-Nile to Kohli, 1 run stump-high full-toss on off stump, clipped down to deep midwicket
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run back of a length on middle and off, pulled to deep midwicket
Zampa to Dhoni, 1 run this is a good, containing length for this pitch. Flat and hurrying through at just under stump height. Goes deep in his crease to whip to long-on

Zampa to Kohli, no run flat again, but much fuller this time, right up near Kohli's back leg. Has to drag his front leg away from the line to try and flick it, and misses. Hits his back leg, but easily missing leg stump
Zampa to Kohli, no run flat length ball outside off, goes on the back foot to chop it to backward point
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run flat again, on middle and leg, goes back and punches to deep midwicket with a straight bat to bring up his fifty
Zampa to Dhoni, no run again that hard-to-attack length, on off stump. Dhoni makes a bit of room to cut, a few yards to the right of backward point
Short to Kohli, 1 run dangled up slow on leg stump, slog-swept on the bounce to deep midwicket
Short to Dhoni, SIX runs floated up and right in Dhoni's slot on off stump. Clears his front leg and gives it the full bottom-hand treatment to deposit it beyond the wide long-on boundary
Short to Dhoni, 1 run flatter, more leg-stumpish. Looks to pull but not quite short enough, drags it to the left of short fine leg off the inner half of his bat
Short to Kohli, 1 run fullish and quickish on off stump, makes some room and flat-bats it hard to long-off

Short to Dhoni, SIX runs monstered. Flights it again, lands it in MS's hitting arc just outside off stump, and he simply clears his front leg and hoicks it high over the midwicket boundary, that's landing in row L on any ground in the world
Short to Dhoni, FOUR runs what a costly decision this has been, giving Short the 18th over. Shortish, on off stump, makes a bit of room and slaps it away to the point boundary
Jhye Richardson to Kohli, no run full slower ball outside off, quite wide. Goes hard at it, looking to hit over cover, and misses

Jhye Richardson to Kohli, 1 wide excellent wide yorker, almost. Maybe a harsh call from Anil Chaudhary too - only marginally past the tramline, but Kohli had shuffled across in premeditation too. Reached out for it but couldn't connect

Jhye Richardson to Kohli, SIX runs bam. Doesn't get his attempted wide yorker wide enough or full enough, and Kohli takes a step across his stumps to get a little closer and swing through the line to clear the long-off boundary comfortably
Jhye Richardson to Kohli, 1 run low full-toss outside off, driven to long-off
Jhye Richardson to Dhoni, 1 run slower ball, back of a length, close to off stump, flat-batted down to long-on
Jhye Richardson to Kohli, 2 runs low full-toss wide of off stump, great hands from Kohli to play a sliced drive into the gap between backward point and sweeper cover. Sharp running too to pick up two

Jhye Richardson to Kohli, FOUR runs wow. Full outside off and Kohli steps across once again and frees his arms through a hard, flat hit straight back over the umpire's head - not that far over - and run away to the boundary in a flash
Cummins to Dhoni, 1 wide wide yorker gone horribly wrong. Dhoni doesn't even attempt to play it, and Handscomb throws himself across the turf to prevent it from running away for even more runs
Cummins to Dhoni, 1 wide another wide outside off stump. Slower short ball, and Dhoni has to reach for it to try and cut it. Can't connect

Cummins to Dhoni, OUT miscued, and Dhoni won't get his fifty. Cummins bowls a cross-seam ball, just short of a good length, on about off stump, and Dhoni, aiming towards long-on, slices it instead and long-off takes a simple catch walking a few steps forward off the rope
Cummins to Kohli, 1 run slower bouncer, gets up to head height over off stump. Kohli shapes to hook and has to adjust to the lack of pace. Helps it along the ground through wide mid-on

Cummins to Karthik, FOUR runs back of a length on off stump and DK doesn't middle it, but he won't care. Goes for the cleared-front-leg pull and drags it off the inside half of his bat, into the gap to the left of short fine leg
Cummins to Karthik, FOUR runs slower bouncer outside off, and DK waits, waits some more, and uppercuts firmly, up and over short third man, to the right of the fielder

Cummins to Karthik, 1 leg bye quick length ball, angling into DK's legs to try and deny him room. Clears his front leg and looks to whip over the leg side, misses, but they sneak a quick leg-bye even as Cummins closes down the ball in his follow-through

Cummins to Kohli, SIX runs down the track, Cummins tries to bowl a slower ball out of his reach, well outside off, but doesn't quite succeed. He only allows Kohli to free his arms, and he does so gleefully to launch a crisp hit over the long-off boundary

8.40pm What a finish. That was Kohli's sixth six. India have clattered 117 in the last 10 overs. Seventy-seven Ninety-one of those came in the last six overs. And yet, they haven't gotten to 200, and Australia are still very much in this game. India, remember, have a weakened attack and are relying on their two allrounders, Krunal Pandya and Vijay Shankar, to bowl eight overs between them. Do join us for the chase. Sreshth will be with you very soon.

8.46pm Hello, and welcome back to the second innings. Still a few minutes to go before the second innings gets underway. Make no mistake, this is barely an above-par total at the Chinnaswamy, but the wicket was double-paced for the first ten overs. Shankar to bowl
Shankar to Short, FOUR runs inswing first up, but drilled through the covers! Full on off, and coming into Short, but he times this well to the wide long-off boundary

Shankar to Short, 1 run length ball, much better line. Once again jagging inwards, and Short inside-edges a flick right onto his pads. Ball rolls away to the off side as they scamper across for a single
Shankar to Stoinis, no run back of a length, just outside off, and Stoinis carefully defends off the back foot
Shankar to Stoinis, FOUR runs length ball, on off stump, and this pace will not bother Stoinis. Swivels, and pulls in front of square to the midwicket boundary
Shankar to Stoinis, no run length ball, slightly outside off stump, and fended off the back foot to cover
Shankar to Stoinis, no run full and wide outside off, and he presses forward to drive. Struck well, but intercepted at cover point
Bumrah to Short, 1 run length ball on leg, and angling across Short. He tiptoes and steers a back-foot tap to point

Bumrah to Stoinis, 2 runs length ball, wide outside off but coming inwards. Punched firmly through the infield, but Krunal chases after it, and parries the ball back to his partner. Solid throw from the deep to MSD
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run back of a length outside off, and he rides the bounce to punch. Off the bat's top-half, and it rolls away to mid off
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run back of a length outside off, and the ball doesn't bounce as much as Stoinis expected it to. Tiptoes to punch, but toe-ends the shot to mid-off this time
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run full outside off, and Stoinis is deceived by the slower ball (116kph). Looks to drive through the covers, but splices the shot to midwicket instead
Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 run back of a length outside off, and the ball jags away slightly. Cut away - but not well - to point for a single
Kaul to Stoinis, no run full just outside off stump, and driven away from his body to mid off. Mistimed on this occasion
Kaul to Finch, no run full outside off, and a bit of outswing from Kaul. Maxi Finch looks to drive away from his body, but the ball whizzes past his outside edge

Kaul to Finch, 2 runs length ball, wide outside off, and he cuts this into the ground. Ball takes an awkward bounce as it's goes over point, but Rahul manages to get a hand to it, and slow the ball's pace down
Kaul to Finch, 2 runs misfield! From Rahul. Full ball outside off, and the square drive seems to go straight to point. But ball goes through him, and he's forced to give the ball a chase
Kaul to Finch, no run full on middle, and he presses forward to defend. Ball rolls away to cover
Shankar to Short, no run back of a length on middle, and Short shapes up to pull. Mistimes a flat-batted shot to mid-on
Shankar to Short, no run length ball on middle, and angling away from Short. Cut square, but can't thread the gap
Shankar to Short, 1 run back of a length on middle, and nudged off the back foot to the sweeper-fielder on the leg side. A walking single for Short
Shankar to Finch, FOUR runs length ball on middle, and worked off his hips to the leg side. Placed behind square, and the fielder at deep midwicket is too far away
Shankar to Finch, no run length ball just outside off. Finch offers the bat's straight face to defend, and taps it back to Shankar
Bumrah to Short, no run appeal for lbw but Bumrah withdraws after realising there's an inside edge. Length ball on leg, and Short misses the swipe towards midwicket
Bumrah to Short, no run full on middle, but Short chooses to go onto the back foot. Tapped to the off side, but finds mid off
Bumrah to Short, 1 run full on middle, and he takes a step backward again, deep into his crease. Pushed to mid-off
Bumrah to Maxwell, 1 run full outside off, but Maxwell shuffles towards the ball's line, before punching to mid-off for a quick single
Bumrah to Short, 1 run full on leg stump, and clipped to deep square leg for a walking single
Bumrah to Maxwell, SIX runs top-edged, but goes all the way! Short ball that's soaring over Maxwell's head, but he attempts to pull, and gets enough connection to clear the boundary behind Dhoni
Kaul to Short, no run full on middle, and swinging slightly away. Driven away from his body, but mistimed to cover's left
Kaul to Short, FOUR runs full on off, and crunched! Just a bit of width, and he picks this early. Smacks it past cover's left for a much-needed boundary. Just four balls left in the Powerplay
Kaul to Short, 1 run back of a length on middle, and he raises his front leg, before pulling along the ground to deep backward square
Kaul to Maxwell, 1 run back of a length on off, and he works this - off his hips - to the gap near square leg. Just a single on offer though

Kaul to Short, FOUR runs full toss wide outside off, and he slaps this freebie to the extra-cover boundary for four. No movement of the feet, all the power coming from his quick hands. Short's not missing those
Kaul to Short, 1 run length ball on off, and angling inwards. Worked off his legs to the sweeper-fielder manning the cow-corner region
Shankar to Short, 1 run back of the hand slower ball, full on leg stump. Muscled through mid-on's left to Chahal at cow corner
Shankar to Maxwell, FOUR runs length ball on middle, and paddled over square leg! Delivery angling in, and he helps the ball over the infielder
Shankar to Maxwell, no run another slower ball, length delivery outside off. He mistimes a square cut to the off side
Shankar to Maxwell, 1 run length ball, wide outside off, and he tries to steer this shot between point and gully. Krunal runs to his left, and dives sideways to stop the ball from sneaking through
Shankar to Short, FOUR runs short on leg, and he stays on the back foot. Raises his front leg, and then helps a pulled-shot over the square-leg umpire's head
Shankar to Short, 1 run slower ball, full on leg, and whipped off his toes to deep midwicket
Chahal to Short, 1 run back of a length, quickish, on off stump, worked away through midwicket

Chahal to Maxwell, FOUR runs shot! That wasn't all that short, and it was pitcing on middle stump and turning away a reasonable deal, but Maxwell rocks back and puts his bottom wrist to full use for a whip-pull that easily beats deep midwicket to his left
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run fuller, on the pads. Misses the flick, or maybe gets an edge on it, and the ball rolls towards short fine leg off the outside of his front pad
Chahal to Short, 1 wide nice idea, but the execution goes slightly wrong. The quicker slider, angled away from Short and forcing him to reach out to drive. Just ends up angling it too wide
Chahal to Short, 1 run googly on a length, worked away wide of midwicket
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 wide looks to bowl that wide line he's bowled with success to Maxwell, but ends up bowling it too wide. Left alone
Chahal to Maxwell, 2 runs back of a length on the pads, nudged away through square leg, and doesn't put too much weight on the shot, so they can scamper two
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run wide length ball, rocks back to slap it to sweeper cover
Krunal to Maxwell, no run flat, back of a length, angling into the stumps, makes room and punches to extra-cover

Krunal to Maxwell, 1 run not that short, angling into middle stump, rocks back and pulls to the left of deep midwicket. Kept slightly low but he watched it well and crouched a little while playing the shot

Krunal to Short, FOUR runs flat, slanted across the left-hander, no turn back in. Lovely shot from Short, hangs back and chops it away to the left of the diving backward point fielder. Not the most athletic-looking effort from Bumrah
Krunal to Short, 1 run back of a length on off stump, makes room and punches to long-off
Krunal to Maxwell, 1 run fired into the pads, clipped into the backward square leg region
Krunal to Short, FOUR runs length ball on off stump, and that's easily put away, just frees his arms and hits it flat and hard, back over the bowler's head
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run fairly full, on the pads, clipped down to long-on

Chahal to Short, 1 run gone, that's an excellent... wait, that's just slipped through Rishabh Pant's grasp at backward point. Short outside off and Short cuts uppishly. Pant dives forward and to his right, and the ball bursts through his hands about a foot off the ground. A dropped chance, relatively straightforward
Chahal to Maxwell, SIX runs shot! A bit of flight outside off, and Maxwell has lofted that effortlessly over the wide long-off boundary
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run looks to clip this through the leg side, closes his face early and sends a leading edge rolling into the point region
Chahal to Short, 1 run fairly full outside off and Short goes for the big loft. Doesn't connect cleanly, and luckily for him it goes flat and bounces well short of long-off
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run fired into the pads, clipped away through midwicket
Krunal to Maxwell, no run flat, back of a length, keeps going with the angle towards the batsman. Clears his front leg to pull but it isn't short enough and sneaks under to hit thigh pad
Krunal to Maxwell, 1 run fuller now, clipped quietly to long-on
Krunal to Short, 1 run flat, back of a length, turning from off to middle, stays back and whips through square leg

Krunal to Maxwell, FOUR runs and Maxwell still finds the boundary. Floats this full and wide, seemingly secure with long-off and extra-cover back, but Maxwell is able to flat-bat this much straighter, bringing his bottom hand into play, and find the gap to the right of long-off
Krunal to Maxwell, 1 run slower this time, on leg stump. Looks to flick and pops a leading edge just out of reach of Krunal, leaping to his left with left arm outstretched
Krunal to Short, 1 run length ball on off stump, stays back and slaps it to long-off
Shankar to Maxwell, no run short outside off, stops on the batsman a little and he chops it down to point

Shankar to Maxwell, FOUR runs slower ball, but it's misdirected, on the pads, and Maxwell still finds enough pace to use and glance it away fine, a long way to the right of long leg who's stationed quite square
Shankar to Maxwell, 1 run another slower ball, loopy and descending onto Maxwell's front foot. Clipped to long leg
Shankar to Handscomb, 1 run back of a length outside off, stabbed away into the cover point region. Doesn't come on for the cut and he ends up meeting it well in front of his body
Shankar to Maxwell, 1 wide slower ball gone wrong, ends up whanging it waaay outside off stump

Shankar to Maxwell, SIX runs wham. He's bowled a lot of slower balls, and Maxwell was well prepared. Back of a length, on off stump, and he's back and across in a flash and has all the time in the world to swat this away over the midwicket boundary. That makes it 13 off this over, and 38 off Shankar's four. I guess India will take it, especially since he got the wicket of Short.
Krunal to Handscomb, 1 run tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
Krunal to Maxwell, 1 leg bye back of a length, cramping Maxwell with the angle from round the wicket. Worked off the hip into the backward square leg region
Krunal to Handscomb, 1 run flat, back of a length, angling into leg stump. Punched down to long-on

Krunal to Maxwell, no run flat length ball on off stump. Goes back almost by rote, and he doesn't have the room to actually punch it where he wants - to long-on. Ends up playing a defensive push into the on side and Krunal cuts off the single
Krunal to Maxwell, 1 run back of a length again, worked to deep midwicket to bring up his second fifty of the series. Excellent innings
Krunal to Handscomb, 1 run again, back of a length, stump-to-stump, angled in from wide of the crease, no turn, and forcing the batsman to go leg-side. Clipped away to deep midwicket
Chahal to Handscomb, no run a couple of steps down the pitch and Chahal fires it a little shorter and wider. Driven to extra-cover
Chahal to Handscomb, 1 run down the track and this time Chahal bowls it at his pads, flat and quick. Clipped away quietly to deep midwicket
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run flat slider on leg stump. Makes a lot of room and opens his bat face to squeeze a single to the right of backward point

Chahal to Handscomb, FOUR runs down the track once again comes Handscomb, and that's a lovely crisp hit. Ends up getting one right in his slot for the inside-out chip over wide long-off, hits it well enough to nearly carry all the way
Chahal to Handscomb, 1 run length ball on middle and off, swept away to the right of deep backward square leg
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run back of a length slider on leg stump, makes room to punch to deep extra cover
Krunal to Maxwell, no run nice change of pace. He usually goes quick, quick, quick, and Maxwell is too early on his slog-sweep, misses and the ball hits him high on the thigh
Krunal to Maxwell, 1 wide wide outside off, back of a length, Maxwell reaches out to cut and misses
Krunal to Maxwell, 1 run back of a length on middle and leg, pulled to deep midwicket
Krunal to Handscomb, 1 run length ball on off stump, pulled in the air, on the bounce to deep backward square leg
Krunal to Maxwell, no run flat length ball angling into off stump, and too quick for the reverse-swat. Bit of an lbw shout, but India don't review. May have straightened just enough to miss off stump

Krunal to Maxwell, SIX runs whoa, that's the biggest hit of this innings. A big front-foot stride to a back-of-a-length ball close to off stump, and he generates incredible power through his hips to wallop that waaay over long-off
Krunal to Maxwell, 1 run flat and back of a length again, and Maxwell goes too early into the pull, drags it along the ground to deep backward square leg
Chahal to Maxwell, 2 runs back of a length on middle and leg, nudged into the vacant midwicket region and they scamper two while the fielder sprints in off the boundary

Chahal to Maxwell, SIX runs full, just outside leg. Was looking to cramp him by attacking his pads, but he's marginally missed his line, and Maxwell gets down on one knee at great speed and swivels through a sweep that easily clears the backward square leg boundary

Chahal to Maxwell, SIX runs Chahal goes to his wide-outside-off line, and Maxwell's response is emphatic, a reverse-sweep off incredible power and bat-speed, whacked over the point boundary. The key was how quickly he created a wide base with his footwork
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run full on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
Chahal to Handscomb, 1 run down the track and Chahal floats a full one outside off. Pushed out to deep extra-cover for one
Chahal to Maxwell, no run flat, fairly wide outside off. Hurries through to beat Maxwell's attempted cut

Bumrah to Handscomb, 1 run shortish outside off, jabbed to the left of backward point. Krunal dives, stops it, and throws to the bowler's end. Bumrah is in front of the stumps, he leaves it, the ball misses the stumps, and they sneak an overthrow
Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR runs full, plenty of width, a rare free hit from Bumrah, and you don't bowl those to Maxwell in this mood. Drives it up and over cover, finishing with a high left elbow
Bumrah to Maxwell, 1 run in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed down to long-off
Bumrah to Handscomb, 1 run length ball on off stump, opens his bat face and steers it down to third man

Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR runs that's a great shot. Not the most attractive shot he's played, and it's muscled rather than timed, but he's gone so deep in his crease to convert a slightly back-of-a-length slower delivery into a short ball and he swivels to beat the diving square leg fielder
Bumrah to Maxwell, 1 run very full outside off, Maxwell slices it flat and hard towards deep point
Kaul to Maxwell, no run short ball just outside off, maybe the knuckle ball, and Maxwell swivels too early into his pull and gets hit on his back
Kaul to Maxwell, SIX runs dismissive. That's smacked the top corner of the sightscreen, on the full. Length ball outside off, and he just clears his front leg and smacks it through the line
Kaul to Maxwell, 1 run in the blockhole on off stump, whipped away to deep square leg
Kaul to Handscomb, 2 runs yorker just outside off, good use of the hands to steer it to the right of third man
Kaul to Handscomb, 1 run back of a length slower offcutter heading towards leg stump. Punched down to long-on

Kaul to Maxwell, (no ball) SIX runs waist-high full-toss. We'll have to check for no-ball here. Yup, it is, but it doesn't matter to Maxwell, who opens up at the hips and simply wallops this over wide long-on. Sensational hitting, moves to 98
Kaul to Maxwell, 1 run another full-toss - seemed close to waist height but perhaps just below - outside off. Maxwell flat-bats it on the full to long-off, but this, of course, is a free hit

Bumrah to Maxwell, 1 run yorker just outside off, jams his bat down and squeezes it past the right of the diving keeper. Off the cue end of the bat, and he'll only get a single, but that's all he needed to bring up his third T20I hundred. First Australian to the mark. What a player.
Bumrah to Handscomb, 1 run length ball outside off, opens his bat face and jabs to backward point
Bumrah to Maxwell, 1 run off-stump yorker. Gets his front foot out of the way and fashions a one-legged flick to square leg
Bumrah to Handscomb, no run full-toss, about stump high, on middle stump. Punched straight back and it hits the middle stump at the other end
Bumrah to Handscomb, 1 run another low-ish full-toss. More leg-stumpish this time. Punched to long-on, bat jarring on impact
Bumrah to Maxwell, 1 run full on off stump, Laxmaned down to long-on
Kaul to Maxwell, 1 run back of a length close to off stump, slapped to point, can't beat the diving fielder
Kaul to Handscomb, 1 run ooh. Backward point is right on the edge of the circle, and Handscomb has opened his bat face and squeezed this off-stump yorker straight to the fielder to get off strike

Kaul to Maxwell, SIX runs make that one off three. What a sensational shot. Attempted yorker misses the length marginally, and the wide-ish full-toss is launched straight back over the bowler's head with an incredible bottom-handed shovel

Kaul to Maxwell, FOUR runs and there's the win, Australia seal a 2-0 series victory. Back of a length on off stump, and Maxwell makes a bit of room and flat-bats it to the right of extra-cover. He's been simply unstoppable today

10.26pm A big confidence boost for Australia ahead of the ODIs, and a big statement from Glenn Maxwell ahead of the World Cup. How this man isn't an ever-present in all formats will remain a mystery to me - he's just too good a player. No one in the world has hands like him. A few questions for India - I thought picking the extra batsman in Vijay Shankar was the right call, but did they score enough? Dhawan's contribution at the top will come under some scrut
It's times like these that make for a good behind-the-scenes look at a player. Here's the story of Glenn Maxwell by SB Tang for the Cricket Monthly.

10.45pm And that is that from this T20I series. Come World Cup, you'd think Australia will have assembled a pretty damn formidable 15, regardless of their poor results in the format over the last couple of years. There's still an ODI series to go before that, and it begins on March 2 in Hyderabad. Be sure to join us for that. Until then, it's goodbye from Sreshth, Chandan and me. Good night!
Australia won by 7 wickets (with 2 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Glenn Maxwell, AUS
